recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large pan, brown the ground beef over medium heat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the pan. Cook until onion is soft.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for 15-20 minutes.
Serve the sauce over cooked spaghetti. Top with grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Grill or cook chicken until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine chopped Romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
Add sliced chicken to the salad.
Drizzle Caesar dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Vegetarian Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
Top with sliced bell peppers, red onions, and black olives.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Remove from the oven, sprinkle fresh basil leaves, and drizzle with olive oil.
Slice and enjoy!

recipes.title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon-Dill Sauce
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried dill, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the lemon-dill mixture.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Serve the grilled salmon with fresh lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli, bell pepper, carrot, and snow peas. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce and sesame oil. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to combine.
Serve the vegetable stir-fry over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
Arrange sliced fresh mozzarella evenly over the sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven, sprinkle fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
Slice and enjoy the classic Margherita pizza!

recipes.title: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until garlic is fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper.
Toss the cooked linguine with the shrimp mixture. Garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve the shrimp scampi immediately.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
instructions: Arrange alternating slices of tomatoes and fresh mozzarella on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle balsamic glaze over the salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the refreshing Caprese salad as a side or appetizer.

recipes.title: Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup
instructions: In a large pot, combine chicken broth, sliced carrots, chopped celery, diced onion, minced garlic, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring the broth to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer.
Add boneless, skinless chicken breasts and cook until chicken is cooked through, about 15-20 minutes.
Remove the cooked chicken from the pot and shred it. Return the shredded chicken to the pot.
Add egg noodles to the pot and cook until tender.
Season the chicken noodle soup with additional salt and pepper if needed.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
